# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's a function `wrap_string` in Julia that wraps text at a specified width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)::String
    words = split(text)
    result = IOBuffer()
    current_line_length = 0
    
    for word in words
        word_length = length(word)
        
        if current_line_length + word_length <= text_width
            write(result, word)
            current_line_length += word_length
        else
            write(result, "\n", word)
            current_line_length = word_length
        end
        
        if current_line_length < text_width
            write(result, " ")
            current_line_length += 1
        end
    end
    
    return String(take!(result))
end

# Example usage:
text = "This is a sample text to demonstrate the wrap_string function."
println(wrap_string(text, 10))
```

This function will wrap the text such that no line exceeds the specified `text_width`. Note that words longer than `text_width` are placed on a new line by themselves.
